alert.note: Alert for South End of the Upper Sierra (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 3:08PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Tulare County through 345 PM PDT... At 307 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles west of Cartago, or 12 miles west of Olancha. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Casa Vieja Meadows and Tunnel Guard Station. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: South End of the Upper Sierra
